elements.title: Okunoin
elements.contents: ... that the hall of worship of Okunoin holds more than 10,000 perpetually lit lanterns (pictured), two of which are believed to have been continually lit for more than 900 years?

elements.title: António Corea
elements.contents: ... that the slave António Corea may have been the first Korean to visit Europe?

elements.title: Indian rhinoceros
elements.contents: ... that an Indian rhinoceros, sent as a gift to Pope Leo X in 1515, was immortalised as Dürer's Rhinoceros after dying in a shipwreck?

elements.title: Robert H. Brooks
elements.contents: ... that Robert H. Brooks passed as a white man to join an all-white unit?

elements.title: 1928 Liechtenstein embezzlement scandal
elements.contents: ... that the 1928 Liechtenstein embezzlement scandal cost 1.8 million Swiss francs, the equivalent of two yearly state budgets?

elements.title: Maxine North
elements.contents: ... that Maxine North swore never to return to Thailand after the death of her undercover CIA husband, but ultimately settled there and introduced bottled water to the country?

elements.title: Imhotep
elements.contents: ... that a review of the board game Imhotep stated that it can be chaotic and "extremely mean"?

elements.title: Franz Jakob Späth
elements.contents: ... that Franz Jakob Späth's fortepianos were favorites of Mozart, but Beethoven refused to play them?
